intro: Sisymbrium linifolium, commonly known as field bean or slender broomrape, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with linear, lance-shaped leaves and a branching stem. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish-yellow, and it produces small, pod-like fruits containing several seeds. Sisymbrium linifolium is often found in disturbed soils and can be a weed in agricultural fields.
